009package BinaryRegions;
010
011import static imagingbook.common.math.Arithmetic.sqr;
012import static java.lang.Math.sqrt;
013
014import java.awt.Color;
015import java.util.List;
016
017import ij.IJ;
018import ij.ImagePlus;
019import ij.plugin.filter.PlugInFilter;
020import ij.process.ByteProcessor;
021import ij.process.ColorProcessor;
022import ij.process.ImageProcessor;
023import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d;
024import imagingbook.common.ij.IjUtils;
025import imagingbook.common.regions.BinaryRegion;
026import imagingbook.common.regions.segment.RegionContourSegmentation;
027
028/**
029 * Shows each region's major axis as a vector scaled by the region's eccentricity.
030 * Also demonstrates the use of the region property scheme, i.e., how
031 * to assign numeric properties to regions and retrieve them afterwards.
032 * Requires a binary (segmented) image.
033 * 
034 * TODO: convert to overlay display
035 * 
036 * @author W. Burger
037 * @version 2020/12/17
038 */
039public class Major_Axis_Demo implements PlugInFilter {
040        
041        static double AxisLength = 50;
042        static Color CenterColor = Color.blue;
043        static Color MajorAxisColor = CenterColor;
044        static int LineWidth = 1;
045        
046        private ImagePlus im;
047        
048        public int setup(String arg, ImagePlus im) {
049                this.im = im;
050                return DOES_8G + NO_CHANGES; 
051        }
052
053        public void run(ImageProcessor ip) {
054                
055                if (!IjUtils.isBinary(ip)) {
056                        IJ.showMessage("Plugin requires a binary image!");
057                        return;
058                }
059                
060                // perform region segmentation:
061                RegionContourSegmentation segmenter = new RegionContourSegmentation((ByteProcessor) ip);
062                List<BinaryRegion> regions = segmenter.getRegions(true);
063
064                // calculate and register certain region properties:
065                for (BinaryRegion r : regions) {
066                        calculateRegionProperties(r);
067                }
068                
069                // create the output (color) image:
070                ColorProcessor cp = ip.convertToColorProcessor();
071                cp.add(210);
072                
073                // draw major axis vectors (scaled by eccentricity): 
074                
075                for (BinaryRegion r : regions) {
076                        if (r.getSize() > 10) {
077                                Pnt2d xc = r.getCenter();
078                                int u0 = (int) Math.round(xc.getX());
079                                int v0 = (int) Math.round(xc.getY());
080                                
081                                double dx = r.getProperty("dx");
082                                double dy = r.getProperty("dy");
083                                int u1 = (int) Math.round(xc.getX() + AxisLength * dx);
084                                int v1 = (int) Math.round(xc.getY() + AxisLength * dy);
085                                
086                                drawCenter(cp,  u0,  v0);
087                                drawAxis(cp, u0, v0, u1, v1);
088                        }
089                }
090                
091                // display the output image
092                new ImagePlus(im.getShortTitle() + "-major-axis", cp).show();
093        }
094        
095        private void calculateRegionProperties(BinaryRegion r) {
096                // calculate central moment mu11, mu20, mu02:
097                Pnt2d xctr = r.getCenter();
098                double xc = xctr.getX();
099                double yc = xctr.getY();
100                double mu11 = 0;
101                double mu20 = 0;
102                double mu02 = 0;
103                for (Pnt2d p : r) {
104                        double dx = (p.getX() - xc);
105                        double dy = (p.getY() - yc);
106                        mu11 = mu11 + dx * dy;
107                        mu20 = mu20 + dx * dx;
108                        mu02 = mu02 + dy * dy;
109                }
110                
111                double A = 2 * mu11;
112                double B = mu20 - mu02;
113                
114                double normAB = Math.sqrt(sqr(A) + sqr(B));
115                double scale = sqrt(2 * (sqr(A) + sqr(B) + B * sqrt(sqr(A) + sqr(B))));
116                
117                double dx = B + normAB;
118                double dy = A;
119                
120                r.setProperty("dx", dx / scale);
121                r.setProperty("dy", dy / scale);
122                
123                // --------------------------------------------------
124                
125                // calculate 2 versions of eccentricity:
126                double a = mu20 + mu02;
127                double b = Math.sqrt(Math.pow(mu20 - mu02, 2) + 4 * mu11 * mu11);
128                r.setProperty("ecc1", (a + b) / (a - b));
129                r.setProperty("ecc2", (Math.pow(mu20 - mu02,  2) + 4 * mu11 * mu11) / Math.pow(mu20 + mu02, 2));
130        }
131        
132        private void drawCenter(ImageProcessor ip, int uc, int vc) {
133                ip.setColor(CenterColor);
134                ip.setLineWidth(LineWidth);
135                ip.drawRect(uc - 2, vc - 2, 5, 5);
136        }
137        
138        private void drawAxis(ImageProcessor ip, int u0, int v0, int u1, int v1) {
139                ip.setColor(MajorAxisColor);
140                ip.setLineWidth(LineWidth);
141                ip.drawLine(u0, v0, u1, v1);
142        }
143
144}
